title: Chile Chooses a New President with Strong Views
summary: In Chile, a country in South America, people voted for a new president named José Antonio Kast. He won the election on Sunday, getting more than half of the votes. Kast is called ultra-conservative, which means he has very strong right-wing ideas. He promised to make Chile safer by reducing crime, send away immigrants who are not legally allowed to stay, and help the economy grow faster. His opponent was Jeannette Jara, who is from the leftist side and wanted different things. Many people cheered for Kast when he won. This election is important because Kast will be the most right-wing president in Chile since the country became a democracy 35 years ago. It shows that voters wanted change from the current government.

background_read: Chile is a country in South America known for being stable and prosperous. It has been a democracy for 35 years after a military dictatorship ended. Elections are held to choose presidents who make decisions about laws, safety, and money. In this election, voters picked a new leader with strong conservative ideas to address problems like crime and immigration.
